titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Elijah Jones and William Norman, Indictment
CWG9040

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commmonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment April Term 1863
Elijah Jones
William Norman

The Grand Jury of Todd County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Elijah Jones, William Norman of the offence of A breach of the peace Committed as follows viz The said Elijah Jones and William Norman on the 10th day of October 1862 in the County "aforesaid" Wilfully and unlawfully by force and armes and with violence entered the House of Noel Stennet and beat bruised and otherwise injured Mrs Margarett Stennett thereby while in possession of said House against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

W T Kennedy Foreman
Grand Jury
E P Campbell Attorney for the Commonwealth.

Information given by
Margarett Stennett
Leander Stennett
Neander Stennett
Dr J N Bartlett

A copy attest
Ben T Perkins C T C C
